titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Kelly Marie Martin Riot Grrrl Collection
1977-2001 (Bulk 1992-1998)
MSS 349
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Laura Newsome, 2012.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-10-23T17:09-0400

did.unittitle: Kelly Marie Martin Riot Grrrl Collection

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The bulk of the collection is open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections. The original master copies for Thorn zine are currently not available to researchers, due to preservation concerns.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Kelly Marie Martin Riot Grrrl Collection; MSS 349; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains zines, magazines, and flyers collected by Kelly Marie Martin in the early and mid-1990s. It also contains copies and original masters of Martin's own zine, Thorn.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is separated into two series:

list.item: Series I: Zines, Magazines, and Flyers

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Kelly Marie Martin is an interdisciplinary artist, musician and activist living in Los Angeles. She plays guitar in the Old Time trio Triple Chicken Foot, with Ben Guzmán on fiddle/mandolin and Mike Heinle on banjo, and is a founding board member and “Cook” at the Bicycle Kitchen, a not-forprofit bicycle repair and education workshop in central Los Angeles.

Martin co-founded the zine Thorn with friend Tammy Rae Carland in San Francisco in 1992, and continued to produce 5 more issues of the zine on her own under the editrix moniker of Keroscene. In 1993, Thorn was "Zine of the Month" in Sassy magazine, and was banned in Canada when it was sent along with the zine Hippie Dick to the Spew conference in Toronto.

Martin has an MFA from the University of California, Irvine, and has exhibited her work in Los Angeles, Philadelphia, and Rejmyre, Sweden and performed at REDCAT and Highways. Her work has been published in The Journal of Aesthetics and Protest, Imaginary Syllabi (Palm Press, 2011), and Cog Magazine as well as in numerous self-published books and zines. In 2009, Martin published a book of her 4x5 photographs called Bike It: Portraits of My Bicipandilla.
